raw:
Arnold: Have you guys heard about digital nomads?

Rachel: Yeah, they're basically people who can work from anywhere as long as they have a laptop and internet access.

Sam: I have a friend who's a digital nomad and travels the world while working remotely.

Arnold: That sounds amazing! Do they have to work specific hours or can they work whenever they want?

Rachel: I think it depends on their job and their employer, but typically they have more flexibility.

Sam: Exactly, but it also requires a lot of self-discipline and organization to balance work and travel.

Arnold: I can imagine, but it sounds like a dream to be able to work while exploring new places.

Rachel: It definitely has its pros and cons, but it's definitely a growing trend in the modern workforce. 

Sam: I could see myself trying it out in the future, but for now, I think I'll stick to a more traditional office job.

sentences.text: Have you guys heard about digital nomads?
sentences.textPhonetics: /hæv ju: gaɪz hɜ:d əbaʊt dɪdʒɪtəl nəʊmædz?/

sentences.text: Yeah, they're basically people who can work from anywhere as long as they have a laptop and internet access.
sentences.textPhonetics: /jæ, ðeɪr ˈbeɪsɪkli ˈpipəl hu kæn wɜrk frɒm ˈenihweər æz lɒŋ æz ðeɪ hæv ə ˈlæpˌtɑp ænd ˈɪntərnɛt ˈæksɛs/

sentences.text: I have a friend who's a digital nomad and travels the world while working remotely.
sentences.textPhonetics: aɪ hæv ə frɛnd hu z ə dɪdʒɪtəl noʊmæd ænd trævəlz ðə wɔrld hwajl wɜrkɪŋ rɪmowtli.

sentences.text: That sounds amazing! Do they have to work specific hours or can they work whenever they want?
sentences.textPhonetics: "ðæt saʊndz əˈmeɪzɪŋ! du ðeɪ hæv tə wɜrk spəˈsɪfɪk ˈaʊɚz ɔr kæn ðeɪ wɜrk wɛnˈɛvər ðeɪ wɑnt?"

sentences.text: I think it depends on their job and their employer, but typically they have more flexibility.
sentences.textPhonetics: aɪ θɪŋk ɪt dɪˈpɛndz ɒn ðeər dʒɒb ənd ðeər ɪmˈplɔɪər, bət ˈtɪpɪkəli ðeɪ hæv mɔːr flɛksɪˈbɪlɪti.

sentences.text: Exactly, but it also requires a lot of self-discipline and organization to balance work and travel.
sentences.textPhonetics: /ɪɡˈzæk.tli bʌt ɪt ˈɔlsoʊ rɪˈkwaɪrz ə lɒt əv sɛlf-ˈdɪsəplɪn ənd ˌɔːrɡənəˈzeɪʃən tə ˈbæləns wɜrk ənd ˈtrævəl./

sentences.text: I can imagine, but it sounds like a dream to be able to work while exploring new places.
sentences.textPhonetics: aɪ kæn ˈɪmədʒɪn, bət ɪt saʊndz laɪk ə driːm tuː bi eɪbl tuː wɜːrk waɪl ɪksplɔːrɪŋ nju ˈpleɪsɪz.

sentences.text: It definitely has its pros and cons, but it's definitely a growing trend in the modern workforce.
sentences.textPhonetics: /ɪt ˈdɛfənɪtli hæz ɪts prəʊz ənd kɒnz, bʌt ɪts ˈdɛfənɪtli ə ˈɡrəʊɪŋ trɛnd ɪn ðə ˈmɒdən ˈwɔːkfɔːs/.

sentences.text: I could see myself trying it out in the future, but for now, I think I'll stick to a more traditional office job.
sentences.textPhonetics: aɪ kʊd si maɪˈsɛlf ˈtraɪɪŋ ɪt aʊt ɪn ðə ˈfjutʃər, bət fɔr naʊ, aɪ ˈθɪŋk aɪl stɪk tu ə mɔr trəˈdɪʃənəl ˈɔfɪs ʤɑb.
